decision_conditions: The mature Horse Chestnut (T5) is situated near to the western boundary of the property in the rear garden and has a moderate amenity value.

This Horse Chestnut  is approximately 14m tall, has a crown spread of approximately 8m and stands about 14m away from the main property. This tree is visible from all sides and is highly visible from the west, making a good contribution to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the local area. It is also an important member of a group of trees in a row - aiding cohesion.

The reasons given are not considered to be justified reasons for the removal of this tree. The Chestnut leaf miner which causes the leaf blotches referred to is present on the majority of the Horse Chestnut trees and it occurs frequently on a seasonal basis each summer. This disease does not have a detrimental impact on the overall health of the trees it affects and only makes the foliage of this tree unsightly for a period of time each year. The other reason given for rem
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: Horse Chesnut (T3) - fell because of excessive shading and it is diseased (seen by leaf blotch). (T5 on TPO 329).
